alert.note: Alert for Kingman; Reno (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 6:52AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Reno and northeastern Kingman Counties through 730 AM CDT... At 651 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pretty Prairie, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Hutchinson, Haven, Pretty Prairie, Arlington, Partridge, Yoder, Waterloo, Cheney Lake, Mt Vernon and Cheney State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central Kansas.
